content.description: This is a great problem on incredible stone. The crux is down low, pulling through a bulge on glassy patina. There are a couple ways to do it. Aim for the hanging dihedral up high, where heroic jugs take you to the top. It also goes from a sit start at a harder grade.
content.protection: Scope the downclimb first, it's either a big jump to a neighboring boulder or the easy face climb to the right.
content.location: Follow the Lion's Mane trail 15 minutes until you see the obvious boulder in a clearing. This problem gets a lot of sun during the day and shade later in the afternoon.

content.description:
This is a steep left-leaning corner next to a large dead tree trunk.  Sit or stand start.  Great rock quality, super fun and well worth the short hike.

Video:

youtu.be/l2Qt2vx-KKY

I know claiming a first ascent in a popular area is tricky.  This one is hidden off the beaten path and seemed like no one had climbed it before.  I’ve asked around, and posting it here is part of that too.  If you’ve climbed this before (or if you go do it after reading this), post up and let me know.
content.protection: Flat landing zone and easy walk-off.
content.location:
150 yards SW of "Behind the Waterfall."  The climb is in a small clearing and faces west.

33.8167425,-116.7584302

content.description: Squeeze your way up the surfboard-shaped prow.  Good rock, fun.
content.location: 50 yards south of Quivering Lips.   Problem faces east.
